 202: '''def wavelet_propag_one_step_cy(wv_x, library, wv_ll, v_p):
 203: 
 204:     # --- Init the propagated wavelet coefficient --- #
 205:     # OUTPUT: matrix full of zeros: wavelet decomposition after propagation
 206:     # wv_x_dx = np.array([dok_matrix((1, wv_x[ii].shape[1]), dtype=np.complex128) for ii in range(wv_x.__len__())])
 207:     # cdef double complex[:,:] wv_x_dx_cy = wv_x_dx  # OUTPUT list of dok matrices
 208:     # # INPUTS (constant)
 209:     # cdef const double complex[:,:] wv_x_cy = wv_x
 210:     # cdef const double complex[:] library_cy = library
 211:     cdef int wv_ll_cy = wv_ll
 212:     cdef int[:] Py_ssize_t
 213:     cdef double complex coef
 214:     cdef int n_coef
 215:     # # define variables
 216:     cdef double complex[:] propagator_lvl
 217:     # cdef int n_scal = int(len(wv_x) / (2**wv_ll))  # number of parameters on the highest levels (scaling function) of the signal vector
 218:     # cdef int n_propa = int(len(library)/(2**wv_ll)) # size of one propagator
 219:     # cdef int n_scal_p = int(n_propa / (2**wv_ll))  # number of parameters on the highest levels (scaling function) of the propagator
 220:     #
 221:     # # define indices (should be declared as Py_ssize_t)
 222:     cdef Py_ssize_t ii_lvl_wv, ii_lvl_pr, ii_q, ii_ind, ii_z, ii
 223:     # cdef Py_ssize_t ii_lib_min, ii_lib_max  # indices for the propagators library
 224:     # cdef Py_ssize_t ii_wv_propa, ii_nz  # final index, where to write the propagated coefficient
 225:     # cdef int ii_check
 226:     # # lists of the number of propagators per level
 227:     cdef const int[:] q_max = calculate_dilation(wv_ll_cy)
 228:     # cdef int[:] list_indices = normalized_indices(wv_ll)
 229:     cdef int q_wv, q_pro, ii_z_current, n_ker, n_ker2, ind_min, ind_max  # = list_q[ii_lvl_wv], number of propagators in the current level
 230:     #
 231:     # # integers used for the counters (right choice of indices)
 232:     # cdef int n_start_lvl_wv_x, n_start_lvl_wv_x_dx, n_start_lib_lvl, n_start_lib_lvl_q, n_start_pro
 233:     # cdef int n_stop_lvl_wv_x, n_stop_lvl_wv_x_dx, n_stop_lib_lvl, n_stop_lib_lvl_q, n_stop_pro
 234:     # # wavelet coefficient
 235:     # cdef double complex wv_coef
 236: 
 237: 
 238:     # --- Init the propagated wavelet coefficient --- #
 239:     # OUTPUT: matrix full of zeros: wavelet decomposition after propagation
 240: 
 241:     # --- Init the propagated wavelet coefficient --- #
 242:     # OUTPUT: matrix full of zeros: wavelet decomposition after propagation
 243: 
 244:     wv_x_dx = [dok_matrix((1, wv_x[ii].shape[1]), dtype=np.complex128) for ii in range(wv_x.__len__())]
 245:     propagator_tmp = [[] for ii in range(wv_x.__len__())]
 246: 
 247:     # ----------------------------------------------------------- #
 248:     # ------------- Propagation in the wavelet domain ----------- #
 249:     # --- LOOP ON THE WAVELET LEVELS OF THE INPUT VECTOR WV_X --- #
 250:     # ----------------------------------------------------------- #
 251:     # q_max = q_max_calculation(wv_ll)
 252:     # --- LOOP ON THE LEVELS OF W_X --- #
 253:     for ii_lvl_wv in range(0, wv_ll_cy + 1):
 254:         # number of propagators at this level
 255:         q_wv = q_max[ii_lvl_wv]
 256:         # --- LOOP ON THE NONZERO COEFFICIENTS OF THIS LEVEL --- #
 257:         # get the indices of the nonzero coefficients (in the columns)
 258:         nz_indices = wv_x[ii_lvl_wv].nonzero()[1]
 259:         # propagators from this level
 260:         propa_lvl_wv = library[ii_lvl_wv]
 261:         for ii_z in nz_indices:
 262:             # print('level ', ii_lvl_wv, ", index ", ii_z)
 263:             # number of propagators at this level
 264:             coef = wv_x[ii_lvl_wv][0, ii_z]
 265:             # propagator to use
 266:             ii_q = ii_z % q_wv
 267:             # choice of the proper propagator from this level
 268:             # propa_lvl_wv_iq is the ii_q^th propagator of level ii_lvl_wv
 269:             propa_lvl_wv_iq = propa_lvl_wv[ii_q]
 270: 
 271:             # #todo: sparsify the propagator after propagation = signal thresholding
 272:             # propagator_tmp = thresholding(propagator_tmp, v_s)
 273:             # --- LOOP ON THE LEVELS OF THE PROPAGATOR --- #
 274:             for ii_lvl_pr in range(0, wv_ll_cy + 1):
 275:                 # number of coefficients at this level
 276:                 n_coef = wv_x[ii_lvl_pr].shape[1]
 277:                 # current ii_z takes into account dilations due to the change of levels.
 278:                 # ii_q is taken positive because the propagator is reversed
 279:                 q_pro = q_max[ii_lvl_pr]
 280:                 ii_z_current = int((ii_z - ii_q) / q_wv * q_pro)
 281:                 # we propagate the level ii_lvl_pr
 282:                 # the coef is included in the propagator
 283:                 propagator_lvl = coef * propa_lvl_wv_iq[ii_lvl_pr]
 284:                 # return propagator for convolution with center at n_ker2
 285:                 n_ker = propagator_lvl.size
 286:                 n_ker2 = n_ker//2
 287: 
 288:                 # convolution --> select the nonzero coefficients of the propagator
 289:                 # scan wv_x_dx in [ii_z_current - n_ker/2, ii_z_current + n_ker/2]. Remove points out of [0,n_coef]
 290:                 ind_min = int(max(0, ii_z_current - n_ker2))
 291:                 ind_max = int(min(n_coef, ii_z_current - n_ker2 + n_ker))
 292: 
 293:                 # # for ii_ind in range(ind_min, ind_max):
 294:                 # for ii_ind in range(0, n_ker):
 295:                 #     wv_x_dx[ii_lvl_pr][0, ii_z_current + ii_ind - n_ker2] += propagator_lvl[n_ker - 1 - ii_ind]
 296: 
 297:                 # for ii_ind in range(ind_min, ind_max):
 298:                 ii = 0
 299:                 # if ind_max >= n_coef:
 300:                 #     print(ind_max)

  __Pyx_XDECREF(__pyx_r);

 370: 
 371: '''
 372: # @package: wavelet_propag_one_step
 373: # @author: Remi Douvenot
 374: # @date: 15/03/2023
 375: # @version: WIP
 376: #
 377: # @brief One step of the SSW 2D free-space propagation -- Cython version
 378: # @param[in] wv_x Wavelet decomposition of the field before the free-space propagation
 379: # @param[in] library Pre-generated wavelet propagators.
 380: # @param[in] family Str wavelet family
 381: # @param[in] wv_ll Integer max wavelet level decomposition
 382: # @param[in] n_z Integer total size of the signal (including image layer and apodisation)
 383: # @param[out] wv_x_dx Wavelet decomposition of the field after the free-space propagation
 384: # @details Cython package that applies the free-space propagators to all the nonzero wavelet coefficients
 385: #
 386: # wv_x structure is [A(J) D(J) D(J-1) ..... D(1)]
 387: # where A(J) is the approximation coefficient vector at the Jth level while D(n) are the detail coefficient vectors
 388: # at the nth level.
 389: 
 390: 
 391: #include <stdio.h>      /* Standard Library of Input and Output */
 392: #include <complex.h>    /* Standard Library of Complex Numbers */
 393: import cProfile, pstats, io
 394: from pstats import SortKey
 395: 
 396: # cython: infer_types=True
 397: 
 398: 
 399: def wavelet_propag_one_step(double complex[:] wv_x, double complex[:] library, int wv_ll):
 400: 
 401:     # --- Init the propagated wavelet coefficient --- #
 402:     # matrix full of zeros: wavelet decomposition after propagation
 403:     wv_x_dx = np.zeros_like(wv_x)
 404:     tmp_py = np.zeros_like(wv_x)
 405:     cdef int n_z = wv_x.shape[0]
 406:     cdef double complex[:] wv_x_dx_cy = wv_x_dx  # vector full of zeros
 407:     cdef double complex[:] tmp = tmp_py
 408:     cdef double complex[:] wv_x_slice
 409:     cdef double complex[:] library_slice
 410:     cdef int[:] list_indices = normalized_indices(wv_ll)
 411:     cdef int[:] list_q = calculate_dilation(wv_ll)
 412:     # define variables
 413:     cdef int q_max  # number of propagators in the current level
 414:     cdef int n_wv  # number of wavelet coefficients in the current level
 415:     cdef int wv_ll_cy = wv_ll
 416:     cdef int n_scal = int(n_z/(2**wv_ll_cy)) # size on one propagator
 417:     cdef int n_lib = int(library.shape[0]/(2**wv_ll_cy)) # size on one propagator
 418: 
 419:     # define indices (should be declared as Py_ssize_t)
 420:     cdef Py_ssize_t ii_lvl, ii_q, ii_z_min, ii_z_max, ii
 421:     cdef Py_ssize_t ii_lib_min, ii_lib_max  # indices for the propagators library
 422: 
 423:     # --------------------------------------------------------------- #
 424:     # ------------- Propagation in the wavelet domain --------------- #
 425:     # --- loop on the wavelet levels of the output vector wv_x_dx --- #
 426:     # --------------------------------------------------------------- #
 427: 
 428:     # each level is propagated independently
 429:     for ii_lvl in np.arange(0, wv_ll+1):
 430:         # @todo Make this operation once and put the result as an input vector
 431:         # calculate :
 432:         # 1/ number of propagators q_max at this level
 433:         # 2/ first and last indices to consider at this level
 434:         q_max = list_q[ii_lvl]
 435:         ii_lib_min = n_lib * list_indices[ii_lvl]
 436:         ii_lib_max = n_lib * list_indices[ii_lvl+1]
 437:         ii_z_min = n_scal * list_indices[ii_lvl]
 438:         ii_z_max = n_scal * list_indices[ii_lvl + 1]
 439:         # number of wavelets on this level
 440:         n_wv = ii_z_max - ii_z_min
 441: 
 442:         # wv_x[ii_z_min:ii_z_max] selects the level of wv_x that we propagate
 443:         # library[ii_lib_min:ii_lib_max] selects the corresponding propagators at this level
 444:         wv_x_slice = np.zeros(ii_z_max-ii_z_min, dtype=np.complex128)
 445:         library_slice = np.zeros(ii_lib_max-ii_lib_min, dtype=np.complex128)
 446:         for ii in range(0,ii_lib_max-ii_lib_min):
 447:             library_slice[ii] = library[ii_lib_min+ii]
 448:         for ii in range(0,ii_z_max-ii_z_min):
 449:             wv_x_slice[ii] = wv_x[ii_lib_min+ii]
 450: 
 451:         tmp = wavelet_propag_one_level(wv_x_slice, library_slice, wv_ll_cy, n_z, n_wv, q_max, list_indices)
 452:         for ii in range(n_z):
 453:             wv_x_dx_cy[ii] = tmp[ii]
 454: 
 455:     return wv_x_dx_cy
 456: 
 457: 
 458: ##
 459: # @package: wavelet_propag_one_level -- Cython version
 460: # @author: Remi Douvenot
 461: # @date: 16/03/2023
 462: # @version: WIP
 463: #
 464: # @brief Add to the current level of wv_x_dx all the propagated wavelets corresponding to the q_max propagators
 465: # @param[in] wv_x Wavelet decomposition of the field before the free-space propagation
 466: # @param[in] library Pre-generated wavelet propagators of the level ii_lvl only.
 467: # @param[in] family Str wavelet family
 468: # @param[in] wv_ll Integer max wavelet level decomposition
 469: # @param[in] n_z Integer total size of the signal (including image layer and apodisation)
 470: # @param[in] ii_lvl Integer current wavelet level
 471: # @param[in] q_max Number of propagators at this level
 472: # @param[out] wv_x_dx Wavelet decomposition of the field after the free-space propagation
 473: # @details Cython package that applies the free-space propagators to all the nonzero wavelet coefficients at the level ii_lvl
 474: ##
 475: 
 476: cdef wavelet_propag_one_level(double complex[:] wv_x_lvl, double complex[:] library_lvl, const int wv_ll, const int n_z, const int n_wv, const int q_max, const int[:] list_indices):
 477: 
 478:     # initialise propagated coefs corresponding to w_x at level ii_lvl
 479:     wv_x_dx_lvl = np.zeros(n_z, dtype=np.complex128)  #
 480:     # this vector is ALWAYS of size n_z/2**L
 481:     cdef int n_scal = int(n_wv/(2**wv_ll))
 482:     # size of one propagator (there are q_max propagators at the current level ii_lvl)
 483:     cdef int n_lib = int(library_lvl.size/q_max)
 484:     # initialise vectors
 485:     wv_x_lvl_q = np.zeros(n_scal, dtype=np.complex128)  # the coefficients on which applying one propagator
 486:     tmp_py = np.zeros_like(wv_x_lvl_q)
 487:     propagator_py = np.zeros(n_lib, dtype=np.complex128)
 488:     # matrix full of zeros: wavelet coefficients at level ii_lvl
 489:     cdef double complex[:] wv_x_dx_lvl_cy = wv_x_dx_lvl  # matrix full of zeros
 490:     cdef double complex[:] wv_x_lvl_q_cy = wv_x_lvl_q
 491:     cdef double complex[:] tmp = tmp_py
 492:     cdef double complex[:] propagator = propagator_py
 493: 
 494:     cdef Py_ssize_t n_lib_init, n_lib_end, ii_q
 495: 
 496:     # loop on the propagators at level ii_lvl
 497:     for ii_q in range(0, q_max):
 498:         # choice of the propagator
 499:         propagator = library_lvl[ii_q*n_lib:(ii_q+1)*n_lib]
 500:         # extract the wavelets that match this propagator
 501:         # this vector is ALWAYS of size n_z/2**L
 502:         wv_x_lvl_q_cy = wv_x_lvl[ii_q::q_max]
 503:         # apply the propagator corresponding to these coefficients
 504:         tmp = add_propagator_at_once(wv_x_lvl_q_cy, propagator, wv_ll, n_z, list_indices)
 505: 
 506:         for ii in range(n_scal):
 507:             wv_x_dx_lvl_cy[ii] = tmp[ii]
 508: 
 509:         # print('fill all orientation time for one coeff',t_end_or-t_start_or)
 510:         # t_end_orp = time.process_time()
 511:         # print('propagate all coeffs for one level one orientation time',t_end_orp-t_start_orp)
 512:     # t_end_level = time.process_time()
 513:     # print('propagate all coeffs for one level time',t_end_level-t_start_level)
 514: 
 515:     return wv_x_dx_lvl_cy
 516: 
 517: 
 518: 
 519: ##
 520: # @package: add_propagator_at_once -- Cython version
 521: # @author: Remi Douvenot
 522: # @date: 20/07/2021
 523: # @version: V1.0
 524: #
 525: # @brief Add to wv_x_dx all the propagated wavelets corresponding to one propagator
 526: # @param[in] wv_x_lvl Wavelet parameters that correspond to the propagator (chosen level and propagator number)
 527: # @param[in] propagator Pre-generated wavelet propagator
 528: # @param[in] wv_ll Max level of the multiscale decomposition
 529: # @param[in] wv_x_dx Wavelet coefficients calculated for wv_x_dx so far
 530: # @param[out] wv_x_dx Wavelet coefficients calculated for wv_x_dx with the inputted "propagator" taken into account
 531: # @details Add to wv_x_dx all the propagated wavelets corresponding to one propagator. For scaling function, the
 532: # propagator is chosen wrt. level and translation. Then convolved by the approx or detail parameters of wv_x_dx
 533: ##
 534: 
 535: 
 536: cdef add_propagator_at_once(const double complex[:] wv_x_lvl, const double complex[:] propagator, int wv_ll, int n_z, const int[:] list_indices):
 537: 
 538:     # lengths of the vectors
 539:     cdef int n_scal = wv_x_lvl.shape[0]  # size of the scaling function = number of passed coefficients
 540:     cdef int n_prop = propagator.shape[0]  # size of the propagator
 541:     cdef int n_prop_scal = int(n_prop/(2**wv_ll))  # size of the scaling function of the propagator
 542:     # indices
 543:     cdef Py_ssize_t ii_p_min, ii_p_max
 544:     cdef Py_ssize_t ii_z_min, ii_z_max, ii_lvl, ii_z
 545: 
 546:     # initialise propagated coefs corresponding to w_x at level ii_lvl and translation ii_q
 547:     wv_x_dx = np.zeros(n_z, dtype=np.complex128)
 548:     cdef double complex[:] wv_x_dx_cy = wv_x_dx
 549:     cdef double complex[:] tmp_convolve
 550:     cdef int n_dilate, n_z_conv
 551: 
 552:     cdef double complex[:] wv_x_dx_lvl_cy
 553: 
 554:     # calculation of the dilation levels
 555:     list_q = calculate_dilation(wv_ll)
 556: 
 557:     # we add to wv_x_dx the propagator affected with the corresponding coefficient
 558:     # loop on the levels of the propagator
 559:     for ii_lvl in range(0, wv_ll + 1):
 560:         # print('ii_lvl2 = ', ii_lvl)
 561: 
 562:         # --- extract level ii_lvl of the propagator --- #
 563:         ii_p_min = n_prop_scal * list_indices[ii_lvl]
 564:         ii_p_max = n_prop_scal * list_indices[ii_lvl+1]
 565:         ii_z_min = n_scal * list_indices[ii_lvl]
 566:         ii_z_max = n_scal * list_indices[ii_lvl + 1]
 567: 
 568:         # number of wavelets on this level
 569:         n_wv = ii_z_max - ii_z_min
 570: 
 571:         # Dilation level
 572:         n_dilate = list_q[ii_lvl]
 573:         # nb of points of the output of the convolution
 574:         n_z_conv = ii_z_max-ii_z_min
 575:         tmp_convolve = convolve_propag(wv_x_lvl, n_dilate, propagator, ii_p_min, ii_p_max, n_z_conv)
 576: 
 577:         wv_x_dx_cy[ii_z_min : ii_z_max] = tmp_convolve
 578:         # for ii_z in range(0, ii_z_max - ii_z_min):
 579:         #     wv_x_dx_cy[ii_z_min+ii_z] = tmp_convolve[ii_z]
 580: 
 581:     return wv_x_dx_cy
 582: 
 583: 
 584: 
 585: ##
 586: # @package: convolve_propag -- Cython version
 587: # @author: Remi Douvenot
 588: # @date: 20/07/2021
 589: # @version: V1.0
 590: #
 591: # @brief Add to wv_x_dx all the propagated wavelets corresponding to one propagator
 592: # @param[in] wv_x_lvl Wavelet parameters that correspond to the propagator (chosen level and propagator number)
 593: # @param[in] propagator Pre-generated wavelet propagator
 594: # @param[in] wv_ll Max level of the multiscale decomposition
 595: # @param[in] wv_x_dx Wavelet coefficients calculated for wv_x_dx so far
 596: # @param[out] wv_x_dx Wavelet coefficients calculated for wv_x_dx with the inputted "propagator" taken into account
 597: # @details Add to wv_x_dx all the propagated wavelets corresponding to one propagator. For scaling function, the
 598: # propagator is chosen wrt. level and translation. Then convolved by the approx or detail parameters of wv_x_dx
 599: ##
 600: 
 601: 
 602: cdef convolve_propag(const double complex[:] wv_x_lvl, int n_dilate, const double complex[:] propagator, Py_ssize_t ii_p_min, Py_ssize_t ii_p_max, int n_z_conv):
 603: 
 604:     # Size of the vector after dilation
 605:     cdef int n_z_dilate = n_dilate * wv_x_lvl.size
 606:     # Size of the propagator to convolve with
 607:     cdef int n_propa = ii_p_max-ii_p_min
 608:     # initialisation of the input signal for convolution
 609:     wv_x_lvl_dilate = np.zeros(n_z_dilate, dtype='complex128')
 610:     # cdef double complex[:] wv_x_lvl_dilate_cy = wv_x_lvl_dilate
 611:     wv_x_dx_lvl = np.zeros(n_z_conv, dtype='complex128')
 612:     # tmp_py = np.zeros_like(wv_x_dx_lvl)
 613:     # tmp2_py = np.zeros_like(wv_x_dx_lvl)
 614:     cdef double complex[:] wv_x_dx_lvl_cy = wv_x_dx_lvl
 615:     # cdef double complex[:] tmp = tmp_py
 616:     # cdef double complex[:] tmp2 = tmp2_py
 617:     # initialisation of the shifted propagator
 618:     propagator_lvl = np.zeros(n_propa, dtype='complex128')
 619:     # cdef double complex[:] propagator_lvl_cy = propagator_lvl
 620:     # the first wavelet of each level corresponds to the input of the propagator
 621:     wv_x_lvl_dilate[::n_dilate] = wv_x_lvl
 622:     # wv_x_lvl_dilate[::n_dilate] = wv_x_lvl
 623:     # --- Convolution --- #
 624:     # propagator
 625:     # TODO : find something to remove this operation
 626:     propagator_lvl[0:-1:] = propagator[ii_p_min+1: ii_p_max]
 627:     # This shift is necessary to "center" the convolution "convolve"
 628:     # the output is the convolution of each nonzero parameter with the propagator
 629:     # propagator_lvl_cy[0] = 0
 630:     # t1 = time.process_time()
 631:     # wv_x_dx_lvl_cy = oaconvolve(wv_x_lvl_dilate, propagator_lvl, mode='same')
 632:     wv_x_dx_lvl = oaconvolve(wv_x_lvl_dilate, propagator_lvl, mode='same')
 633:     # print('time oaconvolve scipy = ', (time.process_time() - t1)*1000)
 634:     #
 635:     # t1 = time.process_time()
 636:     # wv_x_dx_lvl_cy = fftconvolve(wv_x_lvl_dilate_cy, propagator_lvl_cy, mode='same')
 637:     # print('time fft convolve scipy = ', (time.process_time() - t1)*1000)
 638:     # wv_x_dx_lvl_cy = convolve_cy(wv_x_lvl_dilate_cy, propagator_lvl_cy)
 639: 
 640: 
 641:     # print('convolution is ',t_end-t_start, 's')
 642: 
 643:     return wv_x_dx_lvl_cy
 644: 
 645: cdef convolve_cy(const double complex[:] signal, const double complex[:] kernel):
 646:     cdef ssize_t kernel_half, ii_z
 647:     cdef ssize_t x_min, x_max, uu_z, ii_current
 648:     cdef int n_ker, n_sig = signal.shape[0]
 649:     cdef double complex value, tmp
 650:     output = np.zeros(n_sig, dtype = np.complex128)
 651:     cdef double complex[:] output_cy = output
 652: 
 653:     n_ker = kernel.shape[0]
 654:     kernel_half = n_ker // 2   # corresponding to the center of the kernel
 655:     # Do convolution
 656:     for ii_z in range(n_sig):
 657:         if signal[ii_z] == 0:
 658:             continue
 659: 
 660:         # Convolve filter
 661:         for uu_z in range(n_ker):
 662:             tmp = kernel[n_ker - uu_z - 1]
 663:             ii_current = ii_z - uu_z + kernel_half
 664:             try:
 665:                 output_cy[ii_current] = output_cy[ii_current] + tmp * signal[ii_z]
 666:             except IndexError:
 667:                 continue
 668: 
 669:     return output_cy
 670: 
 671: 
 672: ##
 673: # @package: add_propagator_at_once -- Cython version
 674: # @author: Remi Douvenot
 675: # @date: 20/07/2021
 676: # @version: V1.0
 677: #
 678: # @brief Add to wv_x_dx all the propagated wavelets corresponding to one propagator
 679: # @param[in] wv_x_lvl Wavelet parameters that correspond to the propagator (chosen level and propagator number)
 680: # @param[in] propagator Pre-generated wavelet propagator
 681: # @param[in] wv_ll Max level of the multiscale decomposition
 682: # @param[in] wv_x_dx Wavelet coefficients calculated for wv_x_dx so far
 683: # @param[out] wv_x_dx Wavelet coefficients calculated for wv_x_dx with the inputted "propagator" taken into account
 684: # @details Add to wv_x_dx all the propagated wavelets corresponding to one propagator. For scaling function, the
 685: # propagator is chosen wrt. level and translation. Then convolved by the approx or detail parameters of wv_x_dx
 686: ##
 687: 
 688: 
 689: cdef add_propagator_at_once_old(wv_x_lvl, propagator, wv_ll, int n_z):
 690: 
 691:     # lengths of the vectors
 692:     cdef int n_scal = len(wv_x_lvl)  # size of the scaling function = number of passed coefficients
 693:     cdef int n_prop = len(propagator)  # size of the propagator
 694:     cdef int n_prop_scal = int(n_prop/(2**wv_ll))  # size of the scaling function of the propagator
 695:     # indices
 696:     cdef Py_ssize_t ii_p_min, ii_p_max
 697:     cdef Py_ssize_t ii_z_min, ii_z_max
 698: 
 699:     # initialise propagated coefs corresponding to w_x at level ii_lvl and translation ii_q
 700:     wv_x_dx = np.zeros(n_z, dtype=np.complex128)
 701:     cdef double complex[:] wv_x_dx_cy = wv_x_dx
 702: 
 703:     # calculation of the dilation levels
 704:     list_q = calculate_dilation(wv_ll)
 705: 
 706:     # we add to wv_x_dx the propagator affected with the corresponding coefficient
 707:     # loop on the levels of the propagator
 708:     for ii_lvl in range(0, wv_ll + 1):
 709:         # print('ii_lvl2 = ', ii_lvl)
 710: 
 711:         # --- extract level ii_lvl of the propagator --- #
 712:         # @todo Make this operation once and put the result as an input vector
 713:         if ii_lvl == 0:
 714:             ii_z_min = 0
 715:             ii_z_max = n_scal
 716:             ii_p_min = 0
 717:             ii_p_max = n_prop_scal
 718:         else:
 719:             q_max = 2 ** (ii_lvl - 1)
 720:             ii_z_min = n_scal * q_max
 721:             ii_z_max = 2 * n_scal * q_max
 722:             ii_p_min = n_prop_scal * q_max
 723:             ii_p_max = 2*n_prop_scal * q_max  # each time you go twice further in the vector
 724: 
 725:         propagator_lvl = propagator[ii_p_min: ii_p_max]
 726:         # ---------------------------------------------- #
 727: 
 728:         # Dilation level
 729:         t_level_prime = list_q[ii_lvl]
 730:         # Size of the vector after dilation
 731:         n_z_dilate = t_level_prime * wv_x_lvl.size
 732: 
 733:         # initialisation of the input signal for convolution
 734:         wv_x_lvl_dilate = np.zeros(n_z_dilate, dtype='complex')
 735: 
 736:         # the first wavelet of each level corresponds to the input of the propagator
 737:         wv_x_lvl_dilate[::t_level_prime] = wv_x_lvl
 738: 
 739:         # --- Convolution --- #
 740:         propagator_lvl_shift = np.zeros_like(propagator_lvl)
 741:         # This shift is necessary to "center" the convolution "convolve"
 742:         propagator_lvl_shift[0:-1:] = propagator_lvl[1::]
 743:         # the output is the convolution of each nonzero parameter with the propagator
 744: 
 745:         wv_x_dx_cy[ii_z_min: ii_z_max] = wv_x_dx_cy[ii_z_min: ii_z_max] + np.convolve(wv_x_lvl_dilate, propagator_lvl_shift, mode='same')
 746: 
 747:         # print('convolution is ',t_end-t_start, 's')
 748: 
 749:     return wv_x_dx
 750: '''
 751:
